lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/ivy.Ivy.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run ivy.Ivy.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Main class of the Ivy application.
* Handles initialization of UI, storage, and task list, and runs the main program loop.
* Constructs an {@code Ivy} object with given storage file path.
* @param filePath Path to file used for storing tasks.
* Starts the main program loop, handling user input until the user exits.
* Handles a single line of user input.
* @return {@code true} If task list modified, {@code false} otherwise.
* @throws IvyException If command is invalid or arguments are incorrect.
private boolean handleInput(String input) throws IvyException {
* Adds a task to the task list and displays a message.
* Marks a task as done and displays a message.
* @param task {@code Task} to mark as done.
* Marks a task as not done and displays a message.
* @param task {@code Task} to mark as not done.
* Deletes a task at the specified index and displays a message.
* @param index Index of task to delete.
* Represents an exception thrown when a user command does not follow
* Constructs an {@code InvalidFormatException} with an error message
* @param command Command entered by user that has an invalid format.
case "mark" -> "mark requires a single task number: mark <taskNumber>";
case "unmark" -> "unmark requires a single task number: unmark <taskNumber>";
case "deadline" -> "deadline requires a description and /by <time>: deadline <desc> /by <time>";
case "event" -> "event requires a description, /from <start> and /to <end>: event <desc> /from <start> /to <end>";
case "delete" -> "delete requires a single task number: delete <taskNumber>";
case "datetime" -> "Date must be d/M/yyyy and time must be HHmm";
* Represents an exception thrown when a task number provided by the user
* Constructs an {@code InvalidIndexException} with a default error message.
* Represents the base class for all custom exceptions used in Ivy.
public abstract class IvyException extends Exception {
* Constructs an {@code IvyException} with the specified error message.
* Represents an exception thrown when the task list has reached its capacity
* Constructs a {@code TaskListFullException} with a default error message.
* Represents an exception thrown when the user enters a command
* that is not recognised by the application.
* Constructs an {@code UnknownCommandException} with a default error message.
* Provides utility methods for parsing user input into commands,
* Extracts command word from user input.
* @return Argument portion of the input or an empty string if none exists.
* Validates that no arguments are provided for a command.
public static void validateNoArgs(String arg, String command) throws IvyException {
* Parses task number from user input.
* @param arg Argument containing the task number.
* @throws IvyException If the index is invalid.
public static int parseTaskIndex(String arg, String command, int max) throws IvyException {
* Parses a Todo task from user input.
* @throws IvyException If the input format is invalid.
public static Todo parseTodo(String arg) throws IvyException {
* Parses a Deadline task from user input.
* @param arg Input containing description and deadline.
* @throws IvyException If date-time is invalid or not in the expected format.
public static Deadline parseDeadline(String arg) throws IvyException {
* Parses an Event task from user input.
* @param arg Input containing description, start time, and end time.
* @throws IvyException If date-time is invalid or not in the expected format.
public static Event parseEvent(String arg) throws IvyException {
public static String parseKeyword(String arg) throws IvyException {
* Handles saving and loading tasks to and from a file.
* Responsible for initializing the storage file and directory if they do not exist.
* Constructs a {@code Storage} object that manages a file at the given path.
* @param filePath Path of file used to store tasks.
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* @return {@code ArrayList} of {@code Task} objects read from the file.
* Saves the given task list to the storage file.
* @param tasks {@code TaskList} containing tasks to save.
* Represents a task with a specific deadline.
* The deadline is stored as a {@link LocalDateTime} object.
private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy HHmm");
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task from a description and a date-time string.
* @param by Deadline date-time as a string in the format d/M/yyyy HHmm.
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task from a description and a {@link LocalDateTime} object.
* Returns a string representation of task suitable for saving to a file.
* Returns a string representation of task for display to the user.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy h:mma");
* Represents a task with a specific start and end time.
* The start and end times are stored as {@link LocalDateTime} objects.
private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy HHmm");
* Constructs an {@code Event} task from a description and date-time strings.
* @param from Start date-time as a string in the format d/M/yyyy HHmm.
* @param to End date-time as a string in the format d/M/yyyy HHmm.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Constructs an {@code Event} task from a description and {@link LocalDateTime} objects.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Returns a string representation of task suitable for saving to a file.
* Returns a string representation of task for display to the user.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy h:mma");
* Provides methods to add, remove, and access tasks in the list.
* Constructs a {@code TaskList} with the given list of tasks.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* Deletes a task from the list at specified index.
* @param index Index of task to delete.
* @param index Index of task to retrieve.
* Returns total number of tasks in list.
* Represents a Todo task with only a description.
* Constructs a {@code Todo} task with the given description.
* Returns a string representation of task suitable for saving to a file.
* Returns a string representation of task for display to the user.
* Handles all user interactions including reading input and displaying messages.
* Constructs a {@code Ui} object and initializes the input scanner.
* Shows welcome message when program starts.
System.out.println("    What can I do for you?");
* Shows farewell message when program ends.
System.out.println("    Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Reads a line of user input.
System.out.println("    Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays a message when a task has been added.
* @param totalTasks Total number of tasks in list.
public void showTaskAdded(Task task, int totalTasks) {
System.out.println("    Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("    Now you have " + totalTasks + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message when a task has been marked as done.
System.out.println("    Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays a message when a task has been unmarked.
System.out.println("    OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays a message when a task has been deleted.
* @param totalTasks Total number of tasks in list.
public void showTaskDeleted(Task task, int totalTasks) {
System.out.println("    Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println("    Now you have " + totalTasks + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays an error message to the user.
* This method should be called when the program exits to release resources.
System.out.println("    Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
